channel.title: Is this good for my first model?
channel.description: is this good for my first model i made: [IMG]http://i1188.photobucket.com/albums/z408/ruud8/model.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1188.photobucket.com/albums/z408/ruud8/model2.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1188.photobucket.com/albums/z408/ruud8/model3.png[/img] Wireframe: [IMG]http://i1188.photobucket.com/albums/z408/ruud8/model4.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1188.photobucket.com/albums/z408/ruud8/model5.png[/img] [IMG]http://i1188.photobucket.com/albums/z408/ruud8/Model6.png[/img] can you give your opinion, what you like and not like, what i could do better and your rating like 7/10 if you do that i thank you very much

item.title: Is this good for my first model?
item.dc:creator: @ruud123 ruud123
item.description:
@ruud123 wrote:

amy_webb:

I take it you followed the tutorial i made? I need to remake that. It is good to see you’re using prims, but you need to try manipulate those on the handle a bit more. So that square there, which sticks out of the handle, try make a cut in your handle scale that out with the yellow square (expands in all directions) or extrude that section out. From there use the scaling and cutting tools to make that ball at the bottom, there is too much poly in that and you don’t really need it. For the blade, can you zoom in on only the blades wireframe? I have a feeling you did something wrong and the faces are crossing or something, good job for a first model though.

i followed your tutorial and i am that one from skype (house)Ruud(house)
and i added that blade wireframe

Read full topic
item.source: Is this good for my first model?

item.title: Is this good for my first model?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I take it you followed the tutorial i made? I need to remake that. It is good to see you’re using prims, but you need to try manipulate those on the handle a bit more. So that square there, which sticks out of the handle, try make a cut in your handle scale that out with the yellow square (expands in all directions) or extrude that section out. From there use the scaling and cutting tools to make that ball at the bottom, there is too much poly in that and you don’t really need it. For the blade, can you zoom in on only the blades wireframe? I have a feeling you did something wrong and the faces are crossing or something, good job for a first model though.

Read full topic
